page.title: 11Rossett Church
page.content:
The name Rossett is derived from the Welsh 'Yr Orsedd' which means 'the judgement seat'.
The earliest record of a chapel (to St. Leonard) was in 1397. By 1620 there was a chapel dedicated to St. Peter in Rossett. The first Parish Church was built in 1841 and the first vicar, Rev. Thomas Wickham, was appointed in 1863.
The church was not large enough so the present church was started in 1891. The cost of building and furnishings was Â£9000. The church is still in good condition and the original bells are used. Weddings and christenings are regularly performed. Two Flower Festivals have been held at the Church and proved very successful.
